definition: to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.chinese: 但这种说法是靠不住的。

sentences.english: Choose neither a woman nor linen by candle- light.
sentences.chinese: 择妻选麻布，灯下靠不住。

sentences.english: A leading role built on power is unreliable.
sentences.chinese: 把优势建筑在权力上是靠不住的。

sentences.english: Even so, Afghan government forces are unreliable and incompetent.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，阿富汗政府军还是靠不住而又不称职的。

sentences.english: This is a fairly fallacious argument.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个相当靠不住的论调。

sentences.english: We know such people are not to be relied upon.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道这种人是靠不住的。

sentences.english: Even when I'm unreliable, God is reliable.
sentences.chinese: 即使当我靠不住时，上帝始终可靠。

sentences.english: I never would have thought you could be so untrustworthy.
sentences.chinese: 我从来都没有想到你是如此的靠不住。

sentences.english: If there is an emergency, you would not count on hary.
sentences.chinese: 如果有紧急情况，哈利是靠不住的。

sentences.english: But memory is a tricky thing and unreliable when it comes to time or weather.
sentences.chinese: 但是说到时间和天气，记忆会开玩笑，靠不住的。

sentences.english: She may forget to come----she's not very reliable.
sentences.chinese: 她可能忘记来了，她这个人靠不住。

sentences.english: He lies, he bluffs, he's unreliable.
sentences.chinese: 他说谎，大吹牛皮，他靠不住。

sentences.english: Using the cell network is too expensive and wireless is unreliable.
sentences.chinese: 使用蜂窝网络和无线太贵是靠不住的。

sentences.english: I'd never go into business with him. He seems squirrelly to me.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会和他做生意，他看上去靠不住。

sentences.english: Promises are , like piecrust , made to be broken .
I don't believe his story, it sounds a bit lame.
sentences.chinese: 我不信他讲的那一套，他的话听起来有些靠不住。

definition: one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
lit. whoever provides milk is your mother (idiom)/fig. to follow whoever is feeding you/to put one's loyalties where one's interests lie
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: easy to use/to function well/so that/in order to

pinyin: lan4 ni2 fu2 bu4 shang4 qiang2

definition: sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
to hope for sth/to count on/hope
